GamePlayer  0.1.0
A game player for two-player perfect information games, implemented using a min-max game tree

Detailed Description

An abstract static evaluation function.

StaticEvaluator is used by GameTree, and must be sub-classed.

Member Function Documentation

◆ evaluate()

virtual float GamePlayer::StaticEvaluator::evaluate ( GameState const &  state) const
pure virtual

Returns a value for the given state.

A higher value must be better for the first player and a lower value must be better for the second player. The returned value must be greater than or equal to secondPlayerWins() and less than or equal to firstPlayerWins(). Returning firstPlayerWins() or secondPlayerWins() indicates an expected win for that player.

Parameters
stateState to be evaluated
Returns
The value of the state
Note
This function must be overridden

◆ firstPlayerWins()

virtual float GamePlayer::StaticEvaluator::firstPlayerWins ( ) const
pure virtual

Returns the value of a winning state for the first player.

The returned value must be invariant. It must be higher than any other non-winning value returned by evaluate(), but it must be comparably less than std::numeric_limits<float>::max().

Returns
The value of a state in which the first player has won
Note
This function must be overridden

◆ secondPlayerWins()

virtual float GamePlayer::StaticEvaluator::secondPlayerWins ( ) const
pure virtual

Returns the value of a winning state for the second player.

The returned value must be invariant. It must be lower than any other non-wining value returned by evaluate(), but it must be comparably greater than -std::numeric_limits<float>::max().

Returns
The value of a state in which the second player has won
Note
This function must be overridden
